title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.6 | 3-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: even such opulences cannot bewilder a pure devotee, because the pure devotee's mind is fully absorbed in devotional service to Krishna.
segments.summary: This segment explains that a pure devotee, absorbed in Krishna's service, remains unaffected by material opulence, even those that enchant heavenly beings.

segments.key_quote: Constitutionally means the way we are made. We are meant to simply serve, serve, serve.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the constitutional position of the living being as a servant, contrasting it with the illusion of being the served, and highlighting how people are often servants of their senses.

segments.key_quote: Happiness in the service of Krishna is real happiness.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the realization of one's position as a servant through spiritual knowledge, leading to happiness through devotional service to Krishna, contrasting it with illusory material happiness.

segments.key_quote: the whole material world is full of hungry living beings the hunger is not for good food is not for shelter is not for sense gratitude the hunger is for the spiritual atmosphere why because we are spirit soul we are not the body
segments.summary: This segment explains that the material world is full of living beings hungry for spiritual satisfaction, which is often misrepresented as material hunger for food, shelter, and sense gratification, even among the materially satisfied.

segments.key_quote: This hunger is actually for spiritual food, for spiritual shelter, for spiritual defense, and spiritual sense gratification.
segments.summary: This segment elaborates on the concept of spiritual hunger, explaining that the true need is for spiritual food, shelter, defense, and sense gratification, which can be found in association with Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Even Lord Shiva, Lord Brahma, any devata, anybody belonging to this material world cannot give you liberation from material existence.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the limitations of material existence, even in the highest planets like Brahmaloka, and emphasizes that true satisfaction and liberation can only be attained through devotional service to Vishnu/Krishna.

segments.key_quote: He gives liberation to those who are engaged in his devotional service.
segments.summary: This segment concludes by reiterating that liberation is granted only to those engaged in devotional service to the Lord, not through other means.
